product_context.title: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: It worked fairly well for about 3 years. Today I tried to turn the switch on and it didn't work. The physical buttons failed, I can still turn it on through ZWave. Factory reset didn't fix it. Time to find a better brand. Also worth noting: Some features of this dimmer aren't supported by Home Assistant/ZWaveJS. For example, even though the zwave parameters show up in ZWaveJS, changing the LED indicator color doesn't work.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2025
reviews.title: Failed after 3 years

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: I installed these to control 5 HALO HLB4 lights from Home Depot. Everything seems fine but every once in a while the lights flicker. Sometimes just a blink but other times for a few seconds. It is very annoying and impossible to work full time with the flickering. The troubleshooting guide does not really help and this brand is not in the HALO list of compatible dimmers… I guess I should have checked there first but I only found the list after installing these dimmer.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2025
reviews.title: Not compatible with all LED lights

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: Wiring and adding to hubitat was really easy. there were good configuration options for turning off the blue light(which is way too bright). it lets you configure dimming speed but the best it can do is "ASAP". so theres no instant on/off when clicking the button. it always has to dim up/down to the on off position. returning some of these that i didn't want for dimming
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2024
reviews.title: Slow dim, can't switch on/off instantly

reviews.text: I often buy Amazon refurbished to save a few dollars, especially when listed "as new". This one was a total dud; I'm sure Amazon had no way to test it, and it looked good. But as usual, Amazon is wonderful at returns.

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: I purchased two of these Z-Wave switches in July 2024 when my old switch suddenly started to flicker the lights and couldn't be turned on to full power or turned off, either manually or through my Z-Wave controller. This switch worked fine until September 2024 when it failed in the same way as the old switch. The difference is that the old switch was 9 years old before it failed. There are also two other similar switches in the same box on the same circuit controlling different lights. They are also old and work perfectly, so it's not a problem with the circuit or the box. I replaced the switch with the second one that I bought as a spare in July. We'll have to see how long this one lasts.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2024
reviews.title: Failed After 2 Months

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: It stopped talking to the Z-wave hub and I can’t do anything to make it work again. Pair. Unpair. Delete. Nothing! Frustrating. I bought two of these and the other is still working as well as all of my other z-wave switches. Then I tried to contact their support but the link is dead (no such page).
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2024
reviews.title: Broke After 1 Year

I can not not get the actual app to work at all. But Alexa picks it up but it still will not work. This is trash and another imitation switch. I hate and can not stand bs companies. Just all about the dollar. Even your instructions are wrong and telling you to do things that the switch is completely un able to do. Waste of time and money. I couldn’t even throw this switch far enough down the street to please me. Shame on you !!

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: Unlike other smart switches (like iNovelli) if you are thinking about a 3 way installation you cannot use this with a dumb switch. Its not very clear about that. There are other 3 way smart switches that you can pair with a dumb switch.. If you are using it for a standalone application, its a reasonably priced option.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2023
reviews.title: Works, but please read if you are thinking about a 3 way installation

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: I want to rate this higher, but there are a few issues. First, the good. it has decent instructions and comes with a neutral jumper wire in the box. it doesn't take a lot of space compared to some zwave switches in the box. It looks good, although it's a bit brighter white than some of my other switches. I had to reset it before it would pair with my smartthings hub. Once I did that, it worked right away. The biggest issue with this product is that it's range of dimming isn't friendly with many LEDs. When shutting it off, it tries to dim down and that causes flickering. It also seems to flicker in the 30% range with my fixture quite badly. LEDs are extremely common now and some of the newer wifi based smart dimmers let you calibrate a dimming range. This switch does not have such a feature. I feel like if it let me limit dimming between 100-50% it would be fine.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2023
reviews.title: Comparable zwave dimmer

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351

reviews.text: I was very disappointed to discover that the dimmer fades slowly to off with no option to change the ramp rate or set it to instant off. This was a deal breaker for me. On an advanced. Device with other programmable parameters I think instant off / on should be a programmable parameter. Furthermore, one of the internal nut plates on the neutral terminal was cross threaded on arrival.

We had initially used smart bulbs but as they burn out, we've been selectively converting some lights to work with smart switches instead. Installation is straight forward and easy. Just make sure you connect the correct neutral wire behind the wall if you have another switch next to this one.

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: Out of the box, wired it up to replace a defective GE switch and my SmartThings app/hub would not see it. I finally resorted to a Youtube video and found out that you must factory reset this brand before it will be seen. I don't understand this, since it's brand new out of the box why would it need to be reset? So I performed the reset by tapping the top padding 10 times very quickly and then the bottom paddle 10 times. Then SmartThings saw device instantly and it works great. The dimmer function also works well on my LED bulbs. Overall it's a great value compared to other brands.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2022
reviews.title: Good value for a Z-Wave switch but what a hassle getting SmartThings to see it

reviews.text: For the money, it's a great dimmer, however, if you're looking to dim many LED bulbs to low levels, you're going to get flickering. I ended up having to redo a few rooms with lower output fixtures to shorten the dimming range. Yes, a more expensive driver would probably work, but if you're working with those more expensive fixtures, you're also not looking at $30 dimmers.

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: I bought a couple to test out and I was disappointed with how slow they are to react to user input. About a second and a half for the fade animation to start to turn on or off. But this speeds up significantly if they are configured to act as a switch instead of a dimmer. And when they are on, there is a slight hum to the bulbs. I was also disappointed with the number of configuration options these dimmers had. I went with a different brand that uses Z-wave 700 series chips and they were better in every way.

reviews.title: Way too slow

I have excluded it and added z wave repeaters next to this and the hub itself. After 3 nights of messing around with it, i am just going to buy another GE switch as those will actually work.

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: Pros: Paired easily with my ZWave hub and has very good RF performance. Overall tactile feel is crisp and satisfying and gives a quality impression. Supports pre-staging on-level by programming default brightness level (parameter 32). Cons: The default dimming speed is very slow and there's no way to change it, which is ridiculous. I intended to use this with the 3-way add-on switch to control a fixture having three LED bulbs. Initially the fixture had EcoSmart bulbs which flickered badly when dimmed, so I swapped them out for Sylvania TruWave LED bulbs which are highly-rated for dimming performance. With the Sylvania bulbs, dimming up/down is smooth and flicker-free, almost as perfect as incandescents. HOWEVER there is a BIG problem: whenever the lights are dimmed, every few minutes they flash full bright! This spoils any mood set by dimming the lights. Unfortunately this glitch disqualifies the UltraPro ZWave dimmer for me and ultimately I went back to Insteon dimmers which are more expensive but work great.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2021
reviews.title: Can't adjust dimming speed and flickers with LED bulbs

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: I ordered these because they seem exactly like the Jatco or GE Dimmers, but my other 10 GE Dimmers don't flicker on low brightness or when adjusting the brightness level. I'm sure with incandescent bulbs you won't notice it, but if you have LEDs and flickering bothers you then I would spend the extra $ and get the real deal
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2021
reviews.title: LED flicker

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: I bought these for my under cabinet lighting and they work great - no buzzing, perfect dimming. My smart home started with a Wink hub but I switched to SmartThings after Wink’s many outages and the demand for monthly payment. I started with one switch and one bulb but now I've got dozens of devices of all sorts. I think all of these smart switches are made by the same company (Jasco) because I have GE, Enbrighten, and now these UltraPro and they all look and work the same. Don’t hesitate to pick these up for your network. Adds easily to SmartThings as a Zwave device using the QR code on the switch.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2021
reviews.title: Great Zwave switches with dimming

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: I have installed a wide variety of ZWave switches and this is by far the best for several reasons. First and foremost is the slim profile, which is useful (critical) in multi-gang boxes. Not only does it make installation easier, it provides a better cooling profile, which is nice compared to the metal cooling fins of the GE/Jasco switches. The switch itself is responsive, which is something I had a problem with the Zooz switches. Finally, it paired easily with SmartThings.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2021
reviews.title: Best Z-Wave dimmer on the market

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: The switch works weil and feels well made: the mechanism is precise and equal in both directions. However this switch needs an add-on switch for 3-way installations, and rather than buying the add-on, I bought a switch that did not need an add-on to work with existing 3-way switches. I used these switches in applications where there was only one switch to control the lighting.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2021
reviews.title: Good solid switch for standard (not 3 way) lighting.

reviews.productTitle: UltraPro Z-Wave Smart Rocker Light Dimmer with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White Paddle Only, 39351
reviews.text: I expected better compatibility and support. I also expected an easy install. That part was more my mistake in assuming that this would work in 3-way configurations, but nope you need to spend extra on a grossly overpriced switch that is nothing more than a standard dumb switch with a few resistors and a diode. Due to non-specific device profiles in SmartThings not all features are able to be used. I returned these and went with another brand that doesn't need you to replace the other dumb switch for 3-way functions and seemed very responsive to questions.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2021
reviews.title: Fire and forget with limited features compared to lesser known brands.
